sub_title: Passionate about the World of Work | Administration | Social Media Influencer / Blogger
summary:
I am self motivated, goal oriented, accountable and have a strong focus on customer service (internal and external). I have great interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate in both official languages (English and French).

I also love the outdoors! On weekends you can find me hiking in Gatineau Park with my family, canoeing or fishing. I am also a budding amateur mycologist.

treasury_media.title: MavSocial Visual Content Management & Social Publishing Software, Product Features
treasury_media.description:
I just started using MavSocial and find it great for managing my social media, my campaigns and especially for visual management. I can purchase stock photos, edit them and post them to my social media accounts within seconds and without leaving the application. This slideshare highlights some of the features. I hope you will try it out.

I am a brand ambassador for MavSocial and do receive compensation for my hard work and research. Good or bad, my reviews are honest with my readers best interest in mind.

awards.title: Top 20 HR blogs of 2015
awards.description:
Staff Squared's hand picked top 20 bloggers of 2015! With HR now moving at such a pace it's difficult to keep up with the latest trends and developments in the space. These bloggers do a great job of distilling the most useful and important information in to their sites. I ranked #4 on their list:

http://www.staffsquared.com/top-20-hr-blogs/

awards.title: Top 150 Career & Leadership Blogs for Your Success in 2014
awards.description:
Career Rocketeer compiled a list of the top 150 career and leadership blogs to consider.

Selection criteria:
1.Content Quality
2.Recency of Posts
3.Frequency of Posts
4.Overall Site Experience

http://careerrocketeer.com/2014/09/top-150-career-leadership-blogs-2014.html

awards.title: The Top 100 Most Socially-Shared Leadership Blogs of 2013
awards.description:
CMOE compiled a list of every blog post each blog published from January 1, 2013 through November 30, 2013. With this list of blog post URLs they ran them through a tool to help us get all of the social shares data for each post. The tool they used was Social Tally. The social shares data were pulled on December 10th. Each blog post has it's own social share count. CMOE then summed up all the social shares across all blog posts for each blog. The total social shares is what determined the Top 100. 

http://www.cmoe.com/top-shared-leadership-blogs/2013.html

profile_positions.location: Gatineau, Quebec (National Capital Region of Ottawa)
profile_positions.description:
I am now located at Global Affairs Canada (formerly the Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade) in the National Capital Region of Ottawa on the Quebec side. I work for the Director General of Missions Operations helping to coordinate and provide input on all corporate reporting (business plans, continuity plans, critical path, etc), issues and logistics.

Canada has 178 missions in 110 countries. The mandate of the Client Relations and Mission Operations Bureau is to provide a central point of contact for staff of Global Affairs Canada (GAC), partner departments, co-locators and foreign governments at headquarters and abroad.
profile_positions.title: Issues Manager

profile_positions.description:
Take It Personel-ly (TakeItPersonelly.com) is a blog all about where the World of Work intercepts Personal Life. This includes topics on Human Resources, Leadership, Social Media and finding Balance in your Life. Since its inception it has been recognized on many 'Top' Lists for Leadership, Human Resources and Career Growth.

I want to help create better workplaces, with employees who feel comfortable being themselves are engaged and enjoy going to work. Every workplace has the potential to be a great workplace.
profile_positions.title: Author and Publisher

profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant and Office Manager

profile_positions.description:
My most recent position at PCO was that of the Cabinet Committee Coordinator. I handle all the meetings logistics for various Cabinet Committees and liaise with PCO officials and Ministers.

I have also had the pleasure of working in the following areas at PCO: Human Resources, Beyond The Border Project, Audit and Evaluation and the Foreign and Defence Policy Secretariat. 

I was a member of the Administrative Community Advisory Committee and helped to organize learning activities and events for the administrative community at PCO. I was also an active member of PCO's Wellness Committee. In the past I have participated in the GCWCC campaign, as well as being on the steering committee to organize the Town Hall.

The Privy Council Office (PCO) is the hub of non-partisan, public service support to the Prime Minister and Cabinet and its decision-making structures. (www.pco-bcp.gc.ca)
profile_positions.title: Privy Council Office

company.name: Department of Justice Canada | Ministère de la Justice du Canada

profile_positions.company: Department of Justice Canada | Ministère de la Justice du Canada
profile_positions.description:
I facilitated outreach initiatives, training/awareness sessions, workshops and activities related to the Values and Ethics Program of the Workplace Branch. I conducted research and analysis, and provided advice / responses on various topics related to Values and Ethics, as well as Conflicts of Interest. I also maintained data and metrics for the department. I worked to promote and foster a harmonious workplace. 

The Values and Ethics Code of the Department of Justice sets out the values and ethics that guide employees in all their professional activities. It also provides a set of guidelines and principles to support ethical behavior and decision making. I worked to promote the following 5 values:

•Respect for Democracy
•Respect for People
•Integrity
•Excellence
•Stewardship 

The Department of Justice has the mandate to support the dual roles of the Minister of Justice and the Attorney General of Canada. The Department supports the Minister of Justice in his responsibilities for 49 statutes and areas of federal law by ensuring a bilingual and bijural national legal framework principally within the following domains: criminal justice (including youth criminal justice), family justice, access to justice, Aboriginal justice, public law and private international law.
profile_positions.title: Workplace Branch - Advisor for Values and Ethics

company.name: Privy Council Office - Human Resources Department

profile_positions.company: Privy Council Office - Human Resources Department
profile_positions.description:
I worked with the Senior HR Advisor to provide full cycle recruitment and a high level of customer support for my assigned clients within the Privy Council. This included all staffing actions and requirements for approximately 200 clients / secretariats.

I provided input on succession planning and recruitment strategies. I helped to develop job postings, job descriptions, and tools for candidate assessments.   

Accomplishments: 
• Worked on assignment with the Beyond the Borders Action Plan Implementation Team. I worked in collaboration with the Deputy Minister, the Assistant Secretary and a team of  Analysts to help implement policies, procedures and inititatives. Learn more here: www.actionplan.gc.ca
• Qualified for AS-03 Pool 2013-PTP-IA-30002

The Privy Council Office (PCO) is the hub of non-partisan, public service support to the Prime Minister and Cabinet and its decision-making structures.

Specialties: Human Resources, HR, Recruitment, Behavioral Interviewing, Interviewing, Job Descriptions, Candidate Assessment, Event Planning, Travel, Budget, Administration, Customer Service
profile_positions.title: Senior Human Resources Assistant

profile_positions.description:
I acted in the role of a Human Resources Advisor from January 2013 - September 2013. I helped to manage a broad range of Human Resources functions; including all HR administration, personnel file management, HR policy development, recruitment and orientation of hourly as well as salaried staff. I helped to ensure legal compliance (ESA, OHSA, Human Rights Legislation), and provided counseling / progressive discipline on various matters. I also researched and implemented staff training/development programs.

I was also the executive assistant and provided high-level administrative support to the Executive Director and to the Board of Directors. I established and fostered relationships with community leaders and stakeholders. I provided multi-faceted support to the Media Relations Officer. I conducted in-depth research and compiled results for the Executive Director and Board of Directors. I coordinated and set-up board and management meetings and special events. I also provided administrative support to the Governance and Human Resources Committee for the Board of Directors.

Accomplishments:
• I implemented a new training initiative that provided online training on Occupational Health and Safety, AODA and customer service.
• I worked with a team of students from Cairine Wilson High School to develop a presentation and project on The Ottawa Mission. They won $5000 from the Youth Philanthropy Initiative for the Mission.
• Successfully headed committee that organized and planned retirement party for the Executive Director who worked there for over 23 years. This included the dedication and renaming of the Hospice Wing at the Mission.

Specialties: Human Resources, HR, Recruitment, Behavioral Interviewing, Budgeting, Coaching, Compensation Analysis, Employee Engagement, Employee Orientation, Interviewing, Job Descriptions, Performance Management, Training and Development, Talent Management, Team Building, Event Planning, Administration, Customer Service
profile_positions.title: Human Resources & Executive Assistant

profile_positions.description:
I supported the project team in the day to day project administration and coordination of all aspects of assigned projects. This included but is was not limited to: project tracking, financial administration, meeting and event planning, project materials, RFP & contract management, documentation and general administrative support for the projects. Worked on 3 projects: Digital Media, eHealth and Labour Market Studies (coordinated studies/reports on Business Analysts, ICT in Financial Services, Nanotechnology and Cyber security) with an annual budget of over $1 million.

Accomplishments:
• Employee screening and recruitment of a Research Analyst, Marketing Specialist and Communications Consultants, successfully negotiated salary offers and prepared Statements of Work and Orientation.
• Screening and Recruitment of Subject Matters Experts from across Canada to participate in workshops, on advisory committees and to participate in project surveys.
• Helped to develop social media presence (Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook).
• Pushed branding concepts that allowed for greater branding of the Labour Market Research division.
• Authored, edited and proofread project materials and collateral.

The Information and Communications Technology Council of Canada (ICTC) is the only national organization in Canada leading talent capacity research, policy and program development for the digital economy. ICTC works to create a diverse, prepared and highly educated Canadian ICT industry and workforce to position Canada as a leader in the global marketplace. ICTC pushes for innovations that will provide standards, labour market intelligence, career pathways and immigration initiatives for Canadian ICT industry, educators and governments.

Specialties: Project Management, Recruitment, Team Building, Event Planning, Budgeting, Contract Management, Negotiation, Social Media Strategy, Branding, Customer Service
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Coordinator - Research and Policy (Term)

profile_positions.description:
I managed the entire recruitment function for the Public Service Sector (Federal Government). I was promoted within less than a year to Staffing Consultant for Industrial Services Sector. I utilized a consultative sourcing, assessment and selection approach that addressed client needs in a cost effective manner. I managed between 25 – 40 open positions at any one time.

Accomplishments:
• Filled  250+ positions with top notch candidates.
Utilized a wide variety of methods to generate candidates, including web based sourcing, internet postings, internal and external networking, job fairs, and referral programs.
• Exceeded hiring/placement goals.
• Revamped sales and recruiting processes for the Public Service Sector.
• Received recognition for overall achievement and outstanding performance in staffing for Public Sector and Industrial Services Sector.

Randstad Canada - With its unrivalled expertise in matching job seekers with select employers, Randstad Canada is a leading player in the labour market and the main supplier of human resources services in the country.

CKHK-FM is a Canadian radio station that broadcasts a combined pop standards/instrumental easy listening format at 107.7 FM in Hawkesbury. It was launched on April 2nd, 2008 and is operated by Ottawa Media Inc.

CKHK-FM has a similar Easy Listening format to that of CKDX-FM in the Greater Toronto area and CJWL-FM in the Ottawa area, also branded as "The Jewel". The Hawkesbury station was licensed by the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission (CRTC) in 2007.

Specialties: Sales, Marketing, Promotions, Budgeting, Event Planning, Branding, Social Media, Radio Sales, Customer Service

company.name: The Government of Canada Workplace Charitable Campaign (GCWCC)

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Government of Canada Workplace Charitable Campaign (GCWCC) is a charitable giving option developed exclusively for federal public servants and federal retirees. The annual GCWCC takes place in federal government workplaces across the country during the fall campaign period (September to December).

Through the GCWCC, public servants can support United Ways/Centraides, Healthpartners or any other registered Canadian charity of their choosing. United Way, a trusted community partner with a history of making wise investments, manages the campaign on behalf of the Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat.

volunteer_experiences.role: Sales Clerk and Sorter at As Good As New
volunteer_experiences.description:
Volunteer as a sales clerk and help to sort donations given to As Good as New.

As Good As New is a high quality thrift store located in Carleton Place, that is run exclusively by a team of dedicated volunteers, so that all the money generated by the store goes into the women’s and children’s programs at Lanark County Interval House. Lanark County Interval House gives the highest quality of service to women and their children who have experienced abuse and gender based violence.

volunteer_experiences.role: Sponsorship Lead for The Women's Fair Committee
volunteer_experiences.description:
As the Sponsorship Lead I help to obtain funding to run the Women's Fair. As part of the Women's Fair Committee I help to organize the yearly event in which all proceeds go to benefit Lanark County Interval House. This is a volunteer position. I also help with the social media marketing for this event.
Lanark County Interval House gives the highest quality of service to women and their children who have experienced abuse and gender based violence.
Volunteer position in which I help to organize fundraising activities for the 51 Squadron Air Cadets for their programming and events. I also help run the social media for the Squadron.
